intro: Malcolmia maritima f. ramosa, commonly known as the coastal malcolmia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant is native to coastal areas of the Mediterranean and thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. It has a low-growing habit and is often found in dune environments, where it helps stabilize the soil. Its botanical features make it well-adapted to saline and arid conditions.
